tk.hugo4715.learn4j.classifier.knn

Class KNearestClassifier<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • tk.hugo4715.learn4j.classifier.knn.KNearestClassifier<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The label type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Classifier<T>

    public class KNearestClassifier<T>
extends Object
implements Classifier<T>
    This classifier is implementing the K-nearest neighbors algorithm.
    When searching a point label, the classifier finds the k closest points in the reference set (provided in the config) and assign a probability to each label based on how many neighbors had that label
    See Also:
    Wikipedia Page
    {@link KNearestClassifierConfig}

      Classify a new point using this classifier
      boolean isFuzzy()
      This classifier is fuzzy
      Probability of a label = number of time the label appeared in the neighborhood divided by k

      • classify

        public Map<Label<T>,Double> classify(double[] point)
        Description copied from interface: Classifier
        Classify a new point using this classifier
        Specified by:
        classify in interface Classifier<T>
        Parameters:
        point - The point
        Returns:
        A map of labels, with the associated probabilities If the classifier is not fuzzy, the map values are only 1 and 0 There is no obligation to return label with a probability of 0

      • isFuzzy

        public boolean isFuzzy()
        This classifier is fuzzy
        Probability of a label = number of time the label appeared in the neighborhood divided by k
        Specified by:
